[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25526?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25526?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [b72e7ed...895b13d](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25526?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

The linter complained about the ref to `pandas.PeriodIndex`. In the See Also.

I'm not sure if just `PeriodIndex` will give the correct reference to `pandas.PeriodIndex`. It's been a while since I looked at the discovery rules, but I thought that would only work when you're in the same `.. currentmodule`.  I believe that this is inside a `pandas.arrays` currentmodule, so this may fail.

We raise when they're both specified but differ.

On Mon, Mar 4, 2019 at 9:28 AM Joris Van den Bossche <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> *@jorisvandenbossche* commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In pandas/core/arrays/period.py
> <https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25526#discussion_r262107875>:
>
> > @@ -104,13 +104,15 @@ class PeriodArray(dtl.DatetimeLikeArrayMixin, dtl.DatelikeOps):
>          is an ndarray of integers, when `freq` is required. When `values`
>          is a PeriodArray (or box around), it's checked that ``values.freq``
>          matches `freq`.
> +    dtype : PeriodDtype, optional
> +        A PeriodDtype instance from which to extract a `freq`.
>
> Does it override the freq keyword?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25526#pullrequestreview-210200888>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABQHIhkKPwxaercj38o-APIELZZ3Rp51ks5vTTulgaJpZM4bbNaz>
> .
>

> We raise when they're both specified but differ.

Can you then mention this in the docstring you added?
